titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 975) to provide for a reduction in the volume of steel imports, and to establish a steel import notification and monitoring program.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-55, by Mr. Dreier.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 975. It shall be in order without intervention of any point of order to consider the bill in the House. The bill shall be considered as read for amendment. The previous question shall be considered as ordered to final passage without intervening motion except (1) ninety minutes of debate equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Ways and Means and (2) one motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 21.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 114.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/16/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 975 (reducing steel imports and establishing a steel import notification and monitoring program).
